To determine the prognostic value of the Hh-activated stromal gene signature (HSGS), we examined its impact on overall survival using The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) breast invasive carcinoma cohort
19 . The HSGS was not predictive of patient outcome in the unstratified patient cohort (Fig. 2d) but was associated with significantly lower patient overall survival uniquely in the basal breast cancer subtype, where Hh ligand is most frequently overexpressed
6 (Hazard ratio = 9.7 (1.9−48.2); P < 0.001; Fig. 2d).
